direction.raw_text: Paul Picard is dead. EXT. EAST BERLIN STREET - EARLY MORNING Barris looks down from the plane as Picard, on the ground, runs after it.

direction.raw_text: (yelling) Fly, Daedalus, fly! INT. BARRIS'S OFFICE - NIGHT Barris hangs up the phone. He stares off into the distance. The phone rings again, again shattering the silence. INT. GONG SHOW SET - DAY Barris on stage with red stocking hat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the moment we've been waiting for... The contestants appear on stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The winner is Miss Tiny Brooks! A model appears with a trophy and a big check and hands it to an enormously fat woman. The other contestants appluad. two midgets dance. The band plays. A massive amount of confetti and balloons fall on everyone. INT. AUDITORIUM - NIGHT It's the Emmy Awards. Barris is in the audience, next to his starlet date. He sweats through his tuxedo, fidgets. Ed Asner and Caroll O'Connor are on stage presenting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the winner is Taxi! The Taxi theme starts as the winners make their way to the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: James L. Brooks, Stan Daniels, and Ed. Weinberger, executive producers. The starlet whispers into Barris's ear, outraged at the unfairness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see why your shows are never nominated. Barris looks sick.    Jim Brooks is on stage accepting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I honor you, members of the academy, for recognizing and supporting high quality television. INT. BATHROOM - NIGHT Barris is locked in a stall, vomiting. The door to the bathroom opens. Someone enters. Barris peeks through the closed stall door. It's Jim Brooks, whistling and holding his Emmy. He places it next to the sink, unzips his fly and pisses. An agitated Barris pulls his gun from his ankle holster, opens the stall door a crack, and shakily aims the gun at Brooks' back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. TERRACE - DAY ACTUAL BARRIS But as I stood there, I realized, I couldn't kill Jim Brooks, the man who was responsible for such good stuff: Mary Tyler Moore, Rhoda, Cindy, Phyllis, episodes of My Friend Tony. I loved those shows as much as anybody in America. INT. BATHROOM - NIGHT Barris is crying. He turns the gun away from Brooks, almost against his will, and sticks it in his own mouth. After a moment, he realizes he can't do that either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't kill either of us, so I let us both live. Jim Brooks and me. The rest is history. Barris puts the gun away, flushes the toilet and exits the stall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, congratulations, Jim. Brooks turns and looks at Barris.     He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hey!   Thanks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chuck Barris. The Gong Show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, right.     Hey, thanks, Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once again you deserve it. Your shows are the greatest. You bring so much... quality to the medium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.     I appreciate that.    I really do They smile and nod at each other awkwardly. Chuck waits for some sort of return of the compliment. It does not come. They continue to nod at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. OFFICES OF GRACIE FILMS - DAY The actual Jim Brooks is being interviewed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't really remember ever meeting Chuck Barris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the men's room at the Emmys, he says. Brooks thinks, looks at interviewer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not saying it didn't happen. I'm just, y'know... If he remembers it, I'm sure it happened. Really doesn't seem like much of an anecdote though. INT. CHATEAU MARMONT BUNGALOW - NIGHT A big party is in progress. The place is packed. Late seventies celebrities abound. Alan Alda is there. Burt Reynolds, Jamie Farr, Jaye P. Morgan, Gene Gene the Dancing Machine, Pam Dawber, Farrah Fawcett Majors and Lee Majors, John Belushi. Chuck Barris steps out of the bathroom, drink in hand. He wipes his nose like someone who's just snorted coke. He wanders disconsolately and slightly wild-eyed through the crowd. He sits in a chair. A man sitting across from him looks at Barris. His eyes light up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you're Chuck Barris!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love your show!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (unenthused) Great. I'm just heading -- PARTY MAN #1 I have a talent I think you'd really appreciate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. Party Man #1 begins farting "Jingle Bells."   Barris   gets up and moves away. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling after) Hey, didn't you ever hear of Le Petomane? He was a star, buddy! These are totally smell-free! Barris settles by the fireplace.      A pretty woman approaches, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bowing) It's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad to meet you because I wanted to tell you that I've seen The Gong Show and I think you are the most insidious and despicable force in entertainment today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well -- PRETTY WOMAN How dare you subject the rest of the world to your loathsome view of humanity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think it's that loathsome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it then? To mock some poor, lonely people who just crave a little attention in their lives. To destroy them. So everybody's not brilliantly talented. They're still people. They deserve respect and compassion. I mean, who the hell are you? What the fuck have you ever done that elevates you above the pathetic masses? Oh, I forgot, you created The Dating Game. Wow, right up there with the Sistine Chapel. I guess that's what gives you the right to... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, I've got to -- Barris loses himself in the crowd.    He hurries past a guy who recognizes and starts chanting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chuckie Baby! Chuckie Baby!     Chuckie Baby! Barris turns and makes his way through the crowd to the door. EXT. SUNSET BLVD - NIGHT Barris makes his way down the crowded street. People stare, turn their heads to gawk. We hear over and over again: "Hey, isn't that Chuck Barris?" and "Hey, look, The Gong Show guy!", and "Chuckie baby, Chuckie baby!" Barris smiles wanly and nods. People shove paper and pen in his face and he scribbles autographs without stopping. Sweat forms on his brow. His polyester shirt is drenched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was right. What the hell had I done with my life? Among the fans on the street, Barris spots the fat bachelor he killed in London. He sports a bullet hole in his head Barris does a double take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, you're that guy. You're dead. This is screwy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only want to be loved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all I fucking wanted! Barris hurries away from the fat bachelor. He begins to spot others converging on him: the corpses of those he killed, bloody and disfigured. Crazy, angry-looking gonged Gong Show contestants appear in the crowd with weapons. KGB agents in trench coats and sunglasses wield guns, Day of the Dead skeletons dance after him. Barris breaks into a run. Suddenly confetti and balloons pour down on him out of the L.A. night sky. Barris dashes across the street, almost getting hit by a car. He ducks down an alley to catch his breath. As he leans against the wall and heaves, a middle- aged woman appears, somewhat backlit by the street light. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Barris?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Louise Wechsler and I'm here from Tulsa with my family and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, I'm not feeling well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a moment of your time. I love your show. And, well, I, sort of, have a talent myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can stop by the office to audition tomorrow. The woman continues to approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm leaving tomorrow and I was just wondering. See, I dance a little and I was just wondering -- There's no way out of this.     Barris sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, all right. Go ahead. Barris turns to face the woman, who's very close now. She starts to dance around, sort of ballet-like, very badly. Barris watches. She pirouettes, arms above her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very nice. Something in her hand glints in the light. Barris reflexively grabs her arm. It's an ice pick. The two wrestle for it. The woman is extremely strong. Barris jams the palm of his hand up into the woman's nose. She staggers back, but doesn't drop the ice pick. Barris leaps at her. The two roll on the ground. The woman pins Barris. She straddles him and is about to stab him through the air. Barris reaches under her skirt and grabs her crotch. The middle-aged woman is a man. He screams in a distinctly male voice. Barris takes the moment of distraction to grab the ice pick and jam it up through the assailant's chin and into his brain. The assailant slumps over. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2) Barris pushes the body off himself, kneels beside it, and pulls off the wig. He gets up, shaking and heaving. He looks at the body one more time, kicks it in the head with all his might. EXT. TERRACE - DAY ACTUAL BARRIS That was it. I just disappeared. The network had to put The Gong Show into reruns. It was 1981. I holed myself up in this hotel in New York. Parker Hotel. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAY SUBTITLE: NEW YORK CITY, SPRING 1982 We see Barris from above, shivering and naked in the corner. The manuscript pages are piled high next to the typewriter. Barris looks up at the camera with outstretched arms, appealing to the gods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who Am I? There is a pounding on the wall from a neighbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who cares?     Shut the fuck up! There's a knock at the door.    Barris crawls toward it, peeks through the peephole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck.   Shit. Piss. Barris unlocks the door.    Simon Oliver stands there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you know where I was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chuck, Chuck, Chuck, don't be an orangutan. We always know where you are. We always know what you're doing. By the by, I'd think twice before I'd attempt to get that tripe you're writing published. And there's a typo on page -- (CONTINUED) 110. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, what do you want, Oliver? I don't work for you anymore. I have things to... Barris trails off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like you to come back for one last assignment, Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.     Now get... Good-bye
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you might be interested when I tell you it's the mole who fingered your friends Jim Byrd and Paul Picard... and Seigfried Keeler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keeler committed suicide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, of course he did. He threw himself from a twentieth floor window after he strangled himself to death with an electrical cord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) I'm not interested, Oliver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as the mole's alive, you don't have a chance in hell of remaining so. Besides, killing is in your blood, old man. You fit the profile. Barris lunges at Oliver, pushes him against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That fucking profile again! What's the fuck is it?! What the fuck do you bastards know about me, that I don't?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indeed.   Where to begin.   First, let go of me. Barris lets go.    Oliver sits in a chair, straightens his shirt. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see. Well, you had a twin sister, stillborn, strangled by your umbilical cord. Your first hit, Chuck. Your mother always wanted a daughter. She blamed you for your sister's death. And, so, until your sister Phoebe was born, she raised you as a girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and your father the dentist? Not really your father. Your biological father was a man named Edmund James Windsor. A serial killer. A fact your mother didn't know when she had an affair with him in 1930. If you want to look him up, he was also known as the Tarrytown Troll, because he had been described by witnesses as short and ugly. Windsor died in the electrical chair at Ossining in 1939. We believed your self- loathing tendencies coupled with that extra Y chromosome and whatever else you inherited from your father would serve us well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to think what more I can tell you. I'm sure there's more. But you have me at a disadvantage here, Barris. I don't have your files in front of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just leave me the hell alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother always loved the game shows, and you so wanted to please her. We never expected the game show business to work out for you. But that it did, turned out to be in our favor. I guess your need to be a good daughter drove you more than we anticipated. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: (3) Barris lunges at Oliver. The two wrestle on the floor. Barris punches him repeatedly in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?     What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chuck?    It's Pen. Barris brings his gun with him to the door, looks through the peephole, then opens the door. Penny stands there, takes in the room, the mess, the haggard Barris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, how'd you find me? Am I listed in some guidebook or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sent me your last letter on hotel stationary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Well, it's great to see you, Pen. You look beautiful. Barris hugs her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't really. But I appreciate the lie. I know how you hate lying. (looking around) Boy, this place is scary looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (taps his head) The human psyche. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came to take you back to California with me. It's a lonely state without you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Redhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't wait forever for you to ask me to marry you, you know. Well, apparently I can. But I really don't want to. Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (crying) I love you so much. You don't understand. I don't even know why. You're such a schmuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know the half of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not gonna marry me, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if I can. Penny nods her head and leaves.    Barris watches her go, then falls to the floor and weeps. EXT. PLANE - DAY EXT. UNION OYSTER HOUSE, BOSTON - NIGHT INT. UNION OYSTER HOUSE, BOSTON Barris, dressed in a suit, sits with Patricia Watson.     He smiles across the table at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe you finally left your two- hundred-dollar-a-night cave to see me. I'm honored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know, I got a visit this morning from Penny. She's wanted to marry me forever. But she doesn't know who I am, what I've, what I'm capable of. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she can't ever know. So what does she really love? A lie. And I started thinking, Treesh, you are the only woman in the world who truly knows me. I know I've screwed you over in the past, and I'm really sorry. I just want you to know that you're the one I want to be with. I love you, Treesh. Patricia looks at him. Her hard-as-nails demeanor softens. She smiles. Barris smiles and reaches across the table for her hand. EXT. WHARF - NIGHT Barris and Patricia stand looking out at the harbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate myself for how I've lived, Treesh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neitzsche said, "Whoever despises oneself still respects oneself as one who despises."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never thought of that. Jesus, I can't even despise myself with any insight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Insane asylums are filled with people who think they're Jesus or Satan. Very few have delusions of being the guy down the block who works at an insurance company. Wonder what that means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know, I wanted to be a writer once. I wanted to write something that someday some lesser person would quote. But I never did. I'm the lesser person, Treesh. I never said anything meaningful that wasn't said by somebody else first. I am disposable. I disposed of people and I am disposable. (beat) You look cold. Barris drapes his jacket over Patricia's shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chuck, what's gotten into you? You're actually acting like a gentleman. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Barris kisses her.      She lets him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's late. I should get going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose you still won't tell me where you're staying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   But I'll show you. She takes his hand.      They walk off. INT. PATRICIA'S HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Patricia enters followed by Barris.       She turns on the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.    Bourbon. Patricia pours some drinks. There are a couple of chairs near the window. Barris sits in one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been thinking a lot about you lately, Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Patricia approaches Barris with the drinks, hands him one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've missed you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could've fooled me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I've mellowed. Patricia takes Barris by the hand, leads him to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. Boston's a beautiful city. We could start over here. A normal person's life. Together. Selling insurance. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds right. Patricia flops down in the chair that Barris had been sitting in. Barris sits in the chair across from her. Patricia raises her glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To life. Patricia casually slides her hand under the chair cushion. In one swift move, Barris pulls a gun from his ankle and shoots Patricia three times, twice in the head, once in the heart. The force of the bullets has tipped the chair over. Patricia lies sprawled on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bitterly) L'Chaim. Barris stands and looks at Patricia's body.      She holds a gun. INT. QUIET CAFE - MORNING Simon Oliver sits sipping an espresso. He has a black eye and bruised face. Barris enters, looking haggard. He sits and stares at Oliver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's done and I'm done.   Agreed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agreed.   But if you get antsy... and you will. Oliver smiles and walks off. Barris sits for a moment, then stands, walks over to a payphone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Redhead? INT. CHAPEL - DAY Barris and Penny are getting married surrounded by friends in a small chapel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have come here today to join together Penny Pacino and Chuck Barris. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all know Chuck Barris: the creator of The Dating Game, The Newlywed Game, The Family Game... Barris looks at Penny. Should he slug this guy?    She gives him a "be patient" look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... The Game Game, Dream Girl of 1968, Operation Entertainment, How's Your Mother-in-Law? and many others. Chuck Barris who most recently brought us such hits as The Rah-Rah Show, Treasure Hunt, Leave it to the Women, The Dollar-Ninety- Eight Beauty Show, and The Gong Show. The Chuck Barris, who I'm sure will be back with even more shows to... EXT. CHAPEL - DAY Well-wishers, family, fans, photographers, reporters, and passers-by are lined up on either side of a red carpet that leads from the chapel to a limousine waiting at the curb. Barris and Penny emerge from the chapel. Everyone cheers, photos are snapped, rice and confetti are thrown, as the happy newlyweds make their way to the limo, Barris spots a pinky-ringed hand in the crowd holding a gun. Barris pushes Penny toward the white limo. The driver stands there holding the door open. Barris shoves Penny in, then screams at the driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drive, Danny! Now! Barris jumps in the car, the driver slams the door closed, hurries around the driver's door and gets in. The car peals away from the cab. INT. CAR - CONTINUOUS An ashen Barris looks back at the crowd.    Penny watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still looking out window) Pen, I have something to confess. Penny's expression shifts, turns slightly stony.   She's getting ready for something bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stalling) You know me as the creator of The Dating Game, The Newlywed Game, The Family Game, The Game Game, How's Your Mother-in-law, Dream Girl of 1968...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Operation Entertainment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Operation Entertainment. The Rah- Rah Show, Gong Show, The Dollar-Ninety- Eight Beauty Show, The Ra-Rah Show...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said that already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. (beat) Okay, but what you don't know is that I've brutally murdered thirty-three people for the CIA. Penny just stares blankly at Barris, who can't look at her. Suddenly she starts to laugh. Danny joins in. Eventually so does Barris. EXT. TERRACE - DAY The actual Barris is being interviewed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know, I came up with a new game show idea recently. It's called The Old Game. You got three old guys with loaded guns on stage They look back at their lives, see who they were, what they accomplished, how close they came to realizing their dreams. The winner is the one who doesn't blow his brains out. He gets a refrigerator. The camera holds on Barris's face as he puffs a cigar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HOTEL ROOM - MORNING Barris lies sleeping in a tangle of sheets. There's blood on his hands. A knock at the door. Barris jumps awake, grabs his gun. He looks around. The room is a mess, stuff knocked over. There's been a fight. He sees his bloody hands. Another knock.
dialogue.name: dialogue
